p: Peptic ulcer is a common disease that develops in 5 to 10% of the world population at least once during the individual’s lifetime, with an incidence of 0.1–0.3% per year [ 2]. The infection by H. pylori bacteria and the use of NSAIDs are considered to be of the most important predisposing factors for the development of peptic ulcers [ 17, 18]. Studies indicate that about 90% of duodenal ulcers and 70% of gastric ulcers are associated with H. pylori [ 19] and NSAIDs may be responsible for 50% of ulcer formation [ 20].
